intro: Antidesma refractum, commonly known as the African star fruit or false star fruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Antidesma refractum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and local pharmacopoeias.
